result.execSummary:
All charges against Kenneth C Love in this case have been dismissed in this county. The charges were consolidated into a case in another county. See the court record in this case for specific information on the consolidated charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Dismissed - Charges Consolidated into Diff. County

charges.dispoDesc: Dismissed - Charges Consolidated into Diff. County

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth C Love

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth C Love not in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent appeared by video for Kenneth C Love.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. State motions to dismiss due to inability to charge due to insufficient probable cause within the four corners of the Criminal Complaint. On the State's motion, Court orders case dismissed without prejudice.
Off the record. Amanda Parent advised though email that 08/25 @ 0830 would work for new court date.

Defendant Kenneth C Love in court, appear by video with attorney Amanda M. Parent, appear in person.  Defendant Kenneth C Love in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Parent needs more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant to have NO CONTACT with Amir S.

Defendant Kenneth C Love in Court with Attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Kenneth C Love in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Conference held in chambers. Discussion placed on the record. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. 
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint. Court advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing. Defense moved to dismiss. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Dismiss. Court reviewed Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Def in custody will go in front of Feiss for IA.
